Note: Translates and versifies the thought preceding two Latin hexameters in the text.
_description: ‘Pride goes before destruction’ (6 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

Bod410.Transcription:
Pryde þat is ouergartalgate has unquartat þe latter
                    ende for whan pride gos by fornshome shewes euermore wende how he
                    wende

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Pruyde þat is ouergarthalgate hat vnquartatte þe
                    latter endeffor when pryde goith bi foreschame seuet
                    euermorewende hou he wende

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Pruyde þat is ouergartAlgate haþ vnquartAt þe
                    latter endedFor when pryde goþ byforeSchame sewyth euer
                    moreWende hou he wende
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 141.

OxfLinLat52.Transcription:
pride þat is ouergairtalgat hath vnwhartffor where pride
                    gose be foreschame folowos euermoreWende where he wende

CamGon71.Transcription:
Pryde þat ys vngartalgate hath vnquartat þe latter
                    endeffor when pryde goth be foreShame folowith euer morevende
                    were he whende

CamGon364.Transcription:
pride þat is ouere gayrtal gate hait vn quartat þe
                    lattere endefor qwanne pride goth be foreschame suith
                    euermorewende quow ye wende

DULCosViv2.Transcription:
Pruyde þat is owgardalgate hat atte the lattere endefor
                    qwey Pryde goth be foreschame sweth euer morwende how he
                    whende
DULCosViv2.Note: Prosified and corrupt version, written as prose.

EDU82.Transcription:
Pryde that is ouergartalgate hathe on quartat the last end
                    foffor when pryde goeth be foreSchame sueth euer morewende when
                    he wende

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Pryde þat is ouergartalgate haþ vnquartat þe lat
                    endeffo wonne prydegoþ by fore schamesywer euer more
                    wendhowe we wend
Lincoln44.Note: Written as prose; seven lines rhyming aabcdbb.

WorcF19.Transcription:
Prude þat is ouergartalgat hay [sic] vnquartat
                    þe later endeffor wenne prude got by foreschame sewyt euer
                    morewende how a wende
